And a bit of a trivial note for the railway fans: Afyon actually does not have a station but two—the smaller and older British-built

These two stations are separated by just 250 metres from each other (and there was no railway connection between two for a long time), and were originally run by two rival companies. In the early days of Turkish Republic, both companies were absorbed by the Turkish State Railways, and a connecting railway between the stations was laid. Until about 1990s trains to west departed from Afyon Şehir which is now all but practically abandoned, as all passenger trains stop at Ali Çetinkaya since then.
